name: Adho Mukha Svanasana
short_description: Foundational inversion-like pose that lengthens the posterior chain, opens shoulders and hamstrings, and improves circulation.
benefits: Improves overall circulation and energizes the body
steps: Start in tabletop, wrists under shoulders, knees under hips.
Spread fingers, press evenly through palms (especially index–thumb mound).
Tuck toes, exhale and lift knees a few inches.
Send hips up and back; lengthen the spine.
Soften knees to lengthen back, then work heels toward floor without forcing.
Externally rotate upper arms, broaden collarbones; keep head between arms and breathe.
common_mistakes: Rounding the upper back by collapsing through shoulders
Over-straightening legs and tucking pelvis (posterior tilt) which shortens the spine
Dumping weight into wrists instead of engaging through hands and arms
breathing: Even ujjayi-style breaths; exhale to deepen hip hinge, inhale to lengthen through spine.
contraindications: Uncontrolled high blood pressure or glaucoma

name: Adho Mukha Vrksasana
short_description: Freestanding or wall-supported handstand that builds upper-body strength, balance and confidence.
benefits: Strengthens shoulders, arms, wrists and core
Enhances circulation and can boost mood/energy
Builds bone density through weight-bearing on arms
steps: Face a wall, place hands shoulder-width apart about 10–15 cm from wall.
Spread fingers and root through knuckles; arms straight but not locked.
Step into a short Down Dog; gaze between hands.
Swing leading leg up with control while pushing the floor away.
Stack hips over shoulders; bring second leg up to meet the first.
Engage core and inner legs; breathe steadily. Come down with control.
common_mistakes: Over-arching (banana back) from loose ribs and soft core
Hands too narrow or too wide affecting shoulder stacking
Kicking up with momentum instead of controlled hip stack
breathing: Slow, steady nasal breathing; keep ribs knitted on inhale, lengthen through heels on exhale.
contraindications: Pregnancy unless already well-practiced and cleared

name: Akarna Dhanurasana
short_description: ‘Archer’s Pose’ seated balance that draws the foot toward the ear, demanding hip mobility, hamstring length and core control.
benefits: Improves shoulder mobility and grip strength
steps: Sit with legs extended (Dandasana); spine tall.
Loop index–middle finger and thumb around right big toe (or use a strap).
Bend right knee and draw the foot back toward right ear, elbow pointing back.
Keep left leg active and spine upright; broaden chest.
Hold for a few breaths, then release and switch sides.
common_mistakes: Rounding lumbar spine to bring foot up
Yanking the foot with the arm instead of using hip flexion
Letting the straight leg go slack
Shrugging the shoulder toward the ear
breathing: Inhale to lengthen spine; exhale to draw the foot and open the hip without force.
contraindications: Acute knee, hamstring or hip injury
Spinal disc issues or severe low back pain

name: Ananda Balasana
short_description: Supine ‘Happy Baby’ that gently opens hips and groins while relaxing the lower back.
benefits: Decompresses and relaxes the lower back
Can calm the nervous system and reduce stress
steps: Lie on back; exhale, draw knees toward chest.
Hold outer feet (or ankles/shins/strap) with knees wider than torso.
Stack ankles over knees; flex feet and gently pull down.
Keep sacrum heavy and spine long; soften shoulders.
Rock side to side if comfortable; breathe smoothly.
common_mistakes: Tailbone lifting off floor (sacrum not grounded)
Pulling aggressively on feet creating knee strain
Neck tension from lifting the head
breathing: Slow nasal breaths; exhale to soften hip creases and widen groins.
contraindications: Acute knee, hip or ankle injury
Neck or sacroiliac issues without support

name: Anantasana
short_description: Side-reclining leg lift (Sleeping Vishnu) that builds lateral balance and lengthens hamstrings and side body.
benefits: Improves lateral balance and core stability
Can soothe mild low-back tightness with proper alignment
steps: Lie on right side; align heels, hips and shoulders in one line.
Prop head on right palm, elbow under shoulder; press right outer leg down.
Hook left big toe with left fingers (or strap) and bend the knee.
Exhale to extend left leg toward ceiling while keeping pelvis stacked.
Reach through both heels; breathe and hold. Repeat other side.
common_mistakes: Rolling backward or forward (pelvis not stacked)
Locking the knee of the lifted leg
Letting support arm collapse under shoulder
Gripping neck or shrugging top shoulder
breathing: Inhale to find length; exhale to stabilize obliques and extend the lifted leg.
contraindications: Slipped disc, severe sciatica or acute low-back pain
Recent knee, hip or shoulder injury

name: Anjaneyasana
short_description: Low-lunge backbend that opens hip flexors, strengthens legs, and lengthens the spine.
steps: From Downward Dog, step right foot between hands.
Lower left knee to the floor and untuck toes.
Stack right knee above ankle; lift torso upright.
Raise arms overhead, lengthen spine, soften ribs.
Gently press hips forward while keeping core engaged.
Hold steady breath; repeat on the other side.
common_mistakes: Overarching lower back by collapsing core
Leaning weight on back leg instead of grounding front leg
breathing: Inhale to lift and lengthen torso; exhale to deepen into hip flexor stretch.

name: Ardha Chandrasana
short_description: Half-Moon Pose improves balance while strengthening legs and opening chest and hips.
steps: From Triangle Pose, bend front knee and place front-hand on floor or block.
Shift weight onto front leg and lift back leg parallel to floor.
Stack hips; rotate chest upward.
Extend top arm toward ceiling, gaze upward if balanced.
Engage standing leg and lengthen through spine.
common_mistakes: Looking upward too early, losing balance
breathing: Keep breath steady; inhale to extend spine, exhale to maintain balance.

name: Ardha Matsyendrasana
short_description: A seated spinal twist that improves mobility, massages abdominal organs, and realigns the spine.
steps: Sit with legs extended; bend right knee and place foot outside left thigh.
Fold left leg toward right hip (optional).
Inhale, lengthen spine; exhale, twist to the right.
Place right hand behind you and left arm across right knee.
Keep spine tall; breathe deeply; switch sides.
common_mistakes: Using arms to force the twist
breathing: Inhale to lengthen spine; exhale to deepen gentle twist.

name: Ardha Pincha Mayurasana
short_description: Dolphin Pose strengthens shoulders and core while preparing for forearm balance.
benefits: Strengthens shoulders, arms, and upper back
steps: Begin in tabletop; lower forearms to floor shoulder-width apart.
Interlace fingers or keep forearms parallel.
Tuck toes and lift hips similar to Downward Dog.
Press forearms down, lift shoulders away from ears.
Walk feet closer to head for deeper stretch.
breathing: Slow inhales to broaden upper back; exhales to lift hips higher.

name: Astavakrasana
short_description: Eight-Angle Pose is an advanced arm-balance that builds core strength and develops wrist and shoulder stability.
benefits: Builds arm, wrist, and shoulder power
steps: Sit with legs extended; bend right knee and hook right leg over right shoulder.
Plant both hands slightly wider than shoulders.
Cross left foot over right and squeeze legs strongly.
Lean forward, bend elbows like Chaturanga.
Lift hips and extend legs to the side while keeping core engaged.
common_mistakes: Weak leg squeeze causing loss of control
breathing: Steady, short breaths; maintain core engagement through exhale.

name: Baddha Konasana
short_description: A seated hip-opening posture that stretches inner thighs and improves blood flow to the pelvic region.
steps: Sit with spine straight and legs extended.
Bend knees, bring soles of feet together.
Hold feet with hands and draw heels closer to pelvis.
Gently press knees toward the floor without forcing.
Lengthen spine and relax shoulders; hold steady breath.
common_mistakes: Sitting too far from heels causing discomfort
breathing: Inhale to lengthen spine; exhale to soften groin and inner thighs.

name: Bakasana
short_description: Crow Pose is an arm-balance that strengthens the core, wrists, and shoulders while improving balance.
benefits: Prepares body for advanced arm balances
steps: Begin in a squat with feet hip-width apart.
Place hands shoulder-width apart, fingers spread.
Lift hips and place knees high on upper arms.
Lean forward, shifting weight into hands.
Engage core and lift both feet off the ground.
common_mistakes: Placing knees too low on arms
breathing: Slow exhales to maintain control; inhale to lift through upper back.

name: Balasana
short_description: A restful kneeling pose that relaxes the spine, hips, and mind; used frequently as a recovery posture.
benefits: Gently stretches hips, thighs, and low back
Improves digestion by massaging abdominal organs
steps: Kneel on the floor, big toes touching.
Sit back on heels and separate knees hip-width.
Exhale and fold forward, resting torso between thighs.
Extend arms forward or keep by sides.
Rest forehead on mat and breathe slowly.
common_mistakes: Forcing hips to heels despite tightness
breathing: Deep belly breathing to relax pelvic floor and spine.

name: Bharadvajasana I
short_description: A gentle seated spinal twist that stretches shoulders and hips while improving spinal mobility.
steps: Sit with legs extended; bend knees to the right.
Place left foot near right buttock.
Inhale and lengthen spine tall.
Exhale and twist to the left from the waist.
Place left hand behind and right hand on left knee; keep shoulders soft.
common_mistakes: Twisting using arms instead of spine
breathing: Inhale to lift; exhale to deepen twist slowly.

name: Bhekasana
short_description: A deep prone backbend that stretches the quadriceps intensely while expanding the chest and shoulders.
benefits: Deeply stretches quadriceps and hip flexors
steps: Lie prone; bend knees bringing heels toward hips.
Reach back and hold the tops of the feet.
Press feet toward the floor as you lift chest.
Draw shoulder blades together and lengthen spine.
Keep knees grounded and breathe steadily.
breathing: Inhale to lift chest; exhale to deepen thigh stretch gently.

name: Bhujangasana
short_description: A gentle backbend that opens the chest and strengthens the spine, commonly known as Cobra Pose.
steps: Lie on stomach with legs extended and tops of feet on mat.
Place hands under shoulders, elbows close to body.
Inhale and gently lift chest using back muscles.
Press lightly into hands without straightening elbows fully.
Keep shoulders relaxed and gaze forward.
breathing: Inhale as you lift chest; exhale to soften shoulders and lengthen spine.

name: Bhujapidasana
short_description: An arm-balance that strengthens core and upper body by lifting weight between the arms.
steps: Start in a deep squat with feet slightly apart.
Insert arms under legs and place hands on the floor behind heels.
Lift hips and squeeze inner thighs onto upper arms.
Shift weight forward onto hands.
Lift feet off the floor while engaging core.
breathing: Short steady breaths to maintain stability; exhale to lift legs.

name: Camatkarasana
short_description: Wild Thing is a heart-opening backbend that energizes the body and stretches the chest and hip flexors.
benefits: Stretches hip flexors and side body
steps: From Side Plank, step top foot behind the body.
Lift hips upward while rotating chest open.
Extend top arm overhead in an arc.
Keep supporting hand strong and stable.
Open heart toward ceiling and maintain breath.
breathing: Deep inhalations to expand chest; exhale to stabilize shoulders.

name: Cockerel Pose
short_description: An advanced arm-balance similar to Tolasana that requires strong wrist, core, and hip engagement.
steps: Sit cross-legged and place hands beside hips.
Press palms into the floor and engage core strongly.
Lift hips and legs off the floor using arm strength.
Keep ankles crossed tightly.
Maintain balance while lifting chest upward.
breathing: Slow steady breaths; exhale during the lift.

name: Dandasana
short_description: A foundational seated pose that builds posture awareness, strengthens the back, and activates the legs.
benefits: Strengthens hip flexors and spinal muscles
steps: Sit with legs extended forward, feet flexed.
Press thighs into the floor and engage kneecaps.
Lengthen spine upward without rounding.
Place hands beside hips, pressing down to lift chest.
Keep shoulders relaxed and gaze forward.
breathing: Inhale to lengthen spine; exhale to root thighs and soften shoulders.

name: Dhanurasana
short_description: A backbend that deeply stretches the front body and strengthens the back, resembling a bow shape.
benefits: Opens chest, shoulders, and hip flexors
steps: Lie on stomach with hands beside torso.
Bend knees and hold ankles with hands.
Inhale and lift chest and thighs upward.
Pull legs gently to deepen the arch.
Keep breathing steadily and gaze forward.
breathing: Inhale to lift chest and legs; exhale to maintain steady stretch.

name: Dwi Pada Viparita Dandasana
short_description: A deep inverted backbend combining a heart opener and inversion to build strength and flexibility.
steps: Begin in Bridge Pose and lift into Wheel Pose.
Lower crown of head onto mat, hands on head.
Walk feet and elbows closer for support.
Straighten legs and lift chest higher.
Hold pose while maintaining steady breath.
breathing: Slow, steady breathing to maintain chest opening.

name: Garudasana
short_description: An arm and leg-wrapping balancing pose that strengthens the lower body and improves concentration.
steps: Stand tall and bend knees slightly.
Wrap right thigh over left and hook foot.
Extend arms forward and cross right arm under left.
Lift elbows and keep shoulders relaxed.
Hold balance while engaging core.
breathing: Slow breaths to maintain balance and chest openness.

name: Gomukhasana
short_description: A seated pose that deeply stretches shoulders and hips simultaneously, improving flexibility.
steps: Sit with legs extended and bend knees.
Stack right knee over left, feet near hips.
Lift right arm up and bend elbow behind back.
Take left arm behind and clasp fingers.
Lift chest and breathe slowly.
breathing: Steady inhales to lengthen spine; exhale to deepen shoulder stretch.

name: Halasana
short_description: Plow Pose is an inversion that stretches the spine, neck, and shoulders deeply while calming the nervous system.
steps: Lie on your back and lift legs overhead.
Support lower back with hands as legs go behind head.
Touch toes to the floor behind you.
Keep neck neutral and shoulders grounded.
Breathe gently while maintaining pose.
breathing: Slow nasal breathing to maintain calm inversion.

name: Janu Sirsasana
short_description: A forward bend that stretches the hamstrings and opens the hips while calming the mind.
steps: Sit with legs extended forward.
Bend right knee and place foot on inner left thigh.
Inhale and lengthen spine upward.
Exhale and fold forward over left leg.
Hold the foot or shin and breathe deeply.
common_mistakes: Pulling too hard on the foot
breathing: Inhale to lengthen spine; exhale to deepen forward fold.

name: Kapotasana
short_description: A deep heart-opening backbend that stretches the entire front body and improves lung capacity.
steps: Kneel with thighs perpendicular to the floor.
Place hands on lower back and arch gently.
Lean back and bring hands toward feet.
Lower forearms to the floor if flexible.
Lift chest upward and keep breath steady.
breathing: Deep controlled breathing to maintain chest expansion.

name: Krounchasana
short_description: A seated pose that deeply stretches hamstrings and improves postural alignment.
steps: Sit in kneeling position with one leg folded back.
Extend the other leg forward.
Hold the extended foot with both hands.
Lift the leg upward while lengthening spine.
Keep chest lifted and shoulders relaxed.
breathing: Inhale to lift spine; exhale to draw leg gently inward.

name: Kumbhakasana
short_description: A fundamental plank pose that builds full-body strength and core stability.
steps: Start on hands and knees.
Extend legs back and lift knees off the floor.
Keep body in a straight line from head to heels.
Engage core and press through hands.
Hold the pose while breathing steadily.
breathing: Steady breathing; exhale to maintain core engagement.

name: Viparita Karani
short_description: A gentle restorative inversion that improves circulation and relaxes the nervous system.
steps: Sit beside a wall and lie on back.
Swing legs up onto the wall.
Scoot closer until hips touch the wall.
Relax arms beside the body.
Close eyes and breathe slowly.
breathing: Slow nasal breathing, extending exhales for relaxation.

name: Makara Adho Mukha Svanasana
short_description: A dolphin plank variation that strengthens the upper body and core while improving shoulder stability.
steps: Start in forearm plank position.
Keep elbows under shoulders and forearms parallel.
Press through forearms and lift hips slightly.
Maintain a straight line from head to heels.
Engage core and breathe steadily.
breathing: Slow steady breaths; exhale to maintain core activation.

name: Malasana
short_description: A deep yogic squat that opens the hips and stretches the lower body while aiding digestion.
steps: Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width.
Bend knees deeply into a squat.
Bring palms together in front of chest.
Use elbows to gently open knees apart.
Keep spine long and breathe deeply.
breathing: Inhale to lift and lengthen the spine; exhale to sink deeper.

name: Marjaryasana
short_description: A gentle spinal movement pose that improves flexibility and relieves back tension.
steps: Begin in tabletop position.
Spread fingers wide and press into palms.
Exhale and round the spine toward the ceiling.
Tuck chin to chest and engage abdomen.
Inhale to transition back to neutral spine.
breathing: Exhale to round spine; inhale to neutral.

name: Chaturanga Dandasana
short_description: A foundational yoga pose that builds arm, core, and shoulder strength while improving body alignment.
benefits: Builds strong core and abdominal stability
Prepares the body for arm balances
steps: Start in a high plank with shoulders stacked over wrists.
Engage the core and keep body in a straight line from head to heels.
Shift forward slightly so shoulders move past wrists.
Bend elbows straight back, keeping them close to your ribs.
Lower your body halfway down while maintaining a flat back.
Hold briefly with core engaged, then transition to Upward-Facing Dog or return to plank.
breathing: Take slow, steady breaths; exhale while lowering down with control.
contraindications: Weak core or lower back issues

name: Mayurasana
short_description: A powerful arm-balance pose that strengthens the core, wrists, and digestive system.
steps: Kneel and place hands on floor with fingers pointing back.
Bring elbows close to abdomen.
Lean forward and lift legs off ground.
Balance body on hands, keeping torso horizontal.
Maintain steady breath and gaze forward.
common_mistakes: Forcing balance without warming up wrists
breathing: Calm, controlled breathing while maintaining balance.

name: Natarajasana
short_description: A graceful balancing backbend that enhances stability, chest opening, and overall body coordination.
steps: Stand tall in Tadasana.
Shift weight onto right foot.
Bend left knee and grab inner left foot.
Kick foot back while lifting chest forward.
Extend right arm forward to balance.
breathing: Inhale to lift chest; exhale to deepen the stretch while balancing.

name: Parighasana
short_description: A side-bending pose that expands the rib cage and stretches the sides of the body deeply.
benefits: Opens rib cage for better breathing
steps: Kneel on the mat and extend right leg out to the side.
Place right foot flat on the floor.
Inhale and lift arms to shoulder height.
Exhale and bend torso over right leg.
Reach right arm down and left arm overhead.
breathing: Inhale to lengthen spine; exhale to deepen side stretch.

name: Paripurna Navasana
short_description: A core-strengthening boat pose that enhances balance, endurance, and abdominal stability.
steps: Sit with knees bent and feet on floor.
Lift feet so shins are parallel to floor.
Straighten legs to form a V-shape.
Extend arms forward parallel to ground.
Engage core and keep spine long.
breathing: Steady inhales and exhales; exhale to maintain core engagement.

name: Parivrtta Janu Sirsasana
short_description: A revolved forward bend that opens the side body, hamstrings, and promotes spinal mobility.
steps: Sit with legs extended.
Bend right knee and bring foot to inner thigh.
Lean left and hold left foot with left hand.
Twist chest upward and extend right arm overhead.
Breathe deeply while lengthening ribs.
breathing: Inhale to lift and rotate torso; exhale to deepen stretch.

name: Parsva Bakasana
short_description: A twisting arm balance that builds strength, control, and improves body coordination.
steps: Start in a squat with knees together.
Twist torso to right and place hands on floor.
Bend elbows and shift weight onto hands.
Lift feet off floor while engaging core.
Balance on hands with knees on triceps.
breathing: Slow nasal breathing to maintain control and balance.

name: Parsvottanasana
short_description: A deep forward fold that stretches the hamstrings and improves balance, posture, and spinal alignment.
steps: Stand in a wide stance, right foot forward.
Square your hips toward the front leg.
Bring hands to reverse prayer or hips.
Inhale to lengthen spine; exhale to fold over front leg.
Keep both legs strong while breathing steadily.
breathing: Inhale to elongate spine; exhale to deepen forward fold.

name: Pasasana
short_description: A deep twisting squat that enhances spinal mobility, digestion, and hip flexibility.
steps: Squat with feet together and heels grounded.
Twist torso to the right.
Wrap left arm around right knee.
Bind hands behind back if possible.
Keep spine long and breathe deeply.
common_mistakes: Twisting from neck instead of spine
breathing: Inhale to lengthen; exhale to deepen twist.

name: Paschimottanasana
short_description: A classic forward bend that deeply stretches the posterior chain and calms the nervous system.
benefits: Deep stretch for hamstrings and spine
steps: Sit with legs extended forward.
Flex toes toward you and lengthen spine.
Inhale and raise arms.
Exhale and fold forward from hips.
Hold feet, ankles, or shins and breathe calmly.
breathing: Deep nasal breaths; inhale to lengthen spine, exhale to fold deeper.

name: Pawanmuktasana
short_description: A gentle wind-relieving pose that releases gas, improves digestion, and relaxes the lower back.
steps: Lie on your back with legs extended.
Pull right knee toward chest.
Clasp hands around shin.
Lift head toward knee if comfortable.
Repeat on opposite side or hug both knees.
breathing: Exhale while pulling knee in; inhale while releasing.

name: Pincha Mayurasana
short_description: A powerful forearm stand that builds shoulder stability, balance, and full-body control.
steps: Begin in dolphin pose.
Walk feet closer to elbows.
Kick one leg up, then the other.
Engage core to maintain vertical balance.
Keep gaze between hands.
breathing: Steady breathing; exhale to lift and stabilize the core.

name: Prasarita Padottanasana
short_description: A wide-legged forward bend that stretches the entire back body and improves flexibility and balance.
benefits: Deep stretch for hamstrings and inner thighs
Enhances blood flow to the brain
steps: Stand with legs wide apart.
Place hands on hips and inhale to lengthen spine.
Exhale and fold forward from hips.
Place hands on the floor or hold ankles.
Keep legs strong and spine long.
breathing: Exhale to fold deeper; inhale to elongate spine.

name: Purvottanasana
short_description: An intense front-body stretch that strengthens the arms, wrists, glutes, and back.
steps: Sit with legs extended and hands behind hips.
Fingers pointing toward feet.
Press into hands and feet to lift hips upward.
Drop head back gently while opening chest.
Keep body in a straight line.
breathing: Inhale to lift chest; exhale while maintaining posture.

name: Rajakapotasana
short_description: A deep hip-opening backbend that stretches the legs, spine, and chest while improving mobility.
steps: Begin in pigeon pose with one leg forward and the other extended back.
Square hips to the front.
Bend the back knee and reach hands toward the foot.
Lift chest upward and arch back.
Hold the pose while breathing deeply.
breathing: Deep thoracic breathing to open chest and maintain balance.

name: Salabhasana
short_description: A strengthening backbend that activates the posterior chain and improves spinal stability.
steps: Lie on stomach with arms by sides.
Engage core and lift chest, arms, and legs off floor.
Keep gaze forward or slightly down.
Squeeze glutes and lengthen legs upward.
Maintain steady breath.
breathing: Inhale to lift; exhale to stabilize.

name: Salamba Sarvangasana
short_description: A supported shoulder stand that improves circulation, strengthens the neck, and rejuvenates the body.
steps: Lie on your back.
Lift legs upward using core strength.
Support lower back with hands.
Straighten legs vertically.
Keep neck steady and breathe slowly.
common_mistakes: Weight on neck instead of shoulders
breathing: Deep slow breathing; avoid strain.

name: Salamba Sirsasana
short_description: A foundational headstand that builds balance, strength, and enhances blood circulation to the brain.
benefits: Boosts blood flow to the brain
steps: Kneel and interlock fingers to form a forearm triangle.
Place crown of head on the floor with hands supporting the back of the skull.
Lift knees off floor and walk feet close to torso.
Gently lift legs into the air using core strength.
Maintain balance and steady breathing.
common_mistakes: Placing weight on neck instead of forearms
breathing: Slow nasal inhalation and exhalation to maintain balance.

name: Savasana
short_description: A deep relaxation pose practiced at the end of sessions to calm the mind and restore the body.
steps: Lie flat on your back with legs comfortably apart.
Rest arms slightly away from the body, palms facing upward.
Close eyes and relax facial muscles.
Breathe slowly and naturally.
Allow the entire body to sink into the mat.
breathing: Natural, effortless breathing to slow down the nervous system.

name: Setu Bandha Sarvangasana
short_description: A gentle backbend that strengthens the spine and opens the chest, promoting flexibility and stability.
benefits: Opens chest and improves lung capacity
steps: Lie on back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart.
Arms alongside body, palms down.
Press into feet to lift hips upward.
Roll shoulders under and open chest.
Maintain alignment and breathe steadily.
common_mistakes: Feet placed too far from hips
breathing: Inhale to lift hips; exhale while maintaining balance.

name: Sitting Pose
short_description: A simple seated posture used for meditation and breathing practices, promoting calmness and alignment.
steps: Sit cross-legged on the floor or cushion.
Keep spine tall and shoulders relaxed.
Rest hands on knees.
Close eyes and steady your breath.
Maintain calm awareness.
breathing: Smooth, natural inhalation and exhalation.

name: Split Pose
short_description: A deep hamstring and hip-opening posture that enhances lower-body flexibility and mobility.
steps: Begin in a lunge position.
Slowly extend front leg forward.
Slide back leg behind you.
Lower hips toward floor while keeping alignment.
Hold the pose while breathing deeply.
breathing: Deep inhales to expand chest; exhale to sink gently into stretch.

name: Supta Baddha Konasana
short_description: A restorative reclining hip opener that relaxes the body, reduces stress, and supports deep breathing.
benefits: Improves blood flow to pelvic region
steps: Lie on your back with knees bent.
Bring soles of the feet together and let knees drop outward.
Place hands beside the body or on the belly.
Relax shoulders and allow chest to open.
Breathe slowly and naturally.
common_mistakes: Lifting lower back off the mat
breathing: Deep belly breathing to enhance relaxation.

name: Supta Padangusthasana
short_description: A reclined hamstring stretch that improves leg flexibility and relieves lower-back tension.
steps: Lie on your back with legs extended.
Lift one leg and loop a strap around the arch.
Straighten lifted leg toward the ceiling.
Keep opposite leg grounded and hips level.
Hold while breathing deeply.
common_mistakes: Lifting opposite leg off the floor
breathing: Slow inhales to lengthen the spine, exhale to relax into the stretch.

name: Supta Virasana Vajrasana
short_description: A deep reclining stretch of the quadriceps and hip flexors that improves mobility and digestion.
steps: Sit in Vajrasana with knees bent and feet beside hips.
Slowly lean back onto hands, then elbows.
Lower back onto the floor if comfortable.
Keep knees close and spine neutral.
Hold while breathing deeply.
breathing: Steady nasal breathing to release tension in thighs.

name: Tittibhasana
short_description: An advanced arm-balance pose that builds arm strength, core stability, and hip flexibility.
steps: Start in a wide squat.
Slide arms under legs and place hands on floor.
Shift weight forward onto palms.
Lift feet off the ground one by one.
Straighten legs out to the sides while balancing.
common_mistakes: Trying to straighten legs too early
breathing: Slow steady breaths while maintaining balance.

name: Tolasana
short_description: A powerful arm-balance lift that strengthens the core, shoulders, and wrists while improving control.
steps: Sit in Padmasana (Lotus Pose).
Place hands beside hips, fingers pointing forward.
Press palms firmly into the ground.
Lift hips and legs off the floor using shoulder and core strength.
Hold the balance while breathing steadily.
breathing: Controlled deep breathing to maintain balance.
contraindications: Knee restrictions (if cannot sit in lotus)

name: Upavistha Konasana
short_description: A deep seated forward bend that stretches the inner thighs, hamstrings, and hips while calming the mind.
steps: Sit with legs extended wide apart.
Flex your feet and keep spine tall.
Place hands on the floor in front of you.
Slowly walk hands forward while keeping back straight.
Lower torso toward floor and breathe deeply.
breathing: Inhale to lengthen spine, exhale to fold deeper.

name: Urdhva Dhanurasana
short_description: A strong backbend that opens the chest, strengthens the spine, and energizes the entire body.
steps: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart.
Place hands beside ears, fingers pointing toward shoulders.
Press into palms and feet to lift hips upward.
Straighten arms to lift chest and head off floor.
Hold the arch while breathing steadily.
breathing: Deep inhalations to open chest; slow exhalations to maintain control.

name: Urdhva Prasarita Eka Padasana
short_description: A balance-based full-body stretch that lengthens hamstrings while strengthening the back and improving stability.
steps: Start in a standing forward fold (Uttanasana).
Shift weight onto one leg.
Lift other leg straight up behind you.
Keep hips square and spine long.
Reach hands toward floor to maintain balance.
breathing: Inhale to stabilize; exhale to extend leg deeper.

name: Ustrasana
short_description: A deep kneeling backbend that opens the chest, strengthens the back, and improves posture.
steps: Kneel with knees hip-width apart.
Place hands on lower back for support.
Lift chest upward and arch back.
Reach hands toward heels while dropping head back.
Hold the posture with slow breathing.
breathing: Inhale to lift the chest, exhale to deepen the backbend.

name: Utkatasana
short_description: A powerful standing pose that strengthens the legs, core, and back while boosting endurance.
steps: Stand tall with feet together.
Bend knees as if sitting into an imaginary chair.
Raise arms overhead, keeping shoulders relaxed.
Shift weight toward heels and engage core.
Hold posture while breathing steadily.
breathing: Inhale while lifting arms; exhale while sitting deeper.

name: Uttana Shishosana
short_description: A gentle heart-opening pose that stretches the spine and shoulders, combining elements of Child’s Pose and Downward Dog.
benefits: Deeply stretches shoulders and upper back
Opens the chest and improves breathing
Calms the mind and reduces stress
steps: Begin in tabletop position on hands and knees.
Walk hands forward while keeping hips above knees.
Lower chest toward the floor.
Rest forehead or chin on the mat.
Breathe deeply while extending spine.
breathing: Inhale to lengthen spine, exhale to soften chest toward mat.

name: Uttanasana
short_description: A deep forward bend that stretches the hamstrings and calves while calming the mind and relieving tension.
benefits: Improves blood flow to the brain
steps: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Inhale and lengthen spine.
Exhale and fold forward from hips.
Let head hang down and soften shoulders.
Place hands on floor, shins, or ankles.
common_mistakes: Weight too far forward on toes
breathing: Slow exhalations to deepen fold; inhale to lengthen spine.

name: Utthita Padangusthasana
short_description: A standing balance pose that improves stability, strengthens legs, and increases hamstring flexibility.
steps: Stand tall and shift weight to one leg.
Lift the opposite leg and hold big toe with fingers.
Extend the leg forward while standing tall.
Open raised leg to the side if possible.
Hold the pose while maintaining balance.
breathing: Inhale to stabilize; exhale to extend leg deeper.

name: Utthita Parsvakonasana
short_description: A foundational standing pose that builds strength in legs, stretches the side body, and increases stamina.
steps: Start in Warrior II stance.
Bend front knee to 90 degrees.
Place forearm on thigh or hand on floor.
Extend top arm over the ear creating a long diagonal line.
Press feet firmly and open chest upward.
breathing: Inhale to open chest; exhale to deepen stretch.

name: Utthita Trikonasana
short_description: A classic standing pose that stretches the legs and torso while improving balance and core strength.
steps: Stand with feet wide apart.
Turn one foot outward and extend arms sideways.
Reach forward and lower hand to shin or floor.
Extend top arm toward the ceiling.
Rotate chest upward and gaze at raised hand.
breathing: Steady breathing; exhale to deepen side stretch.

name: Vajrasana
short_description: A simple kneeling posture often used for meditation and breathing practices. It aids digestion and promotes calmness.
benefits: Strengthens pelvic floor and lower back
Calms the mind and reduces stress
Improves blood circulation to abdominal organs
steps: Kneel on the floor with knees together.
Sit back on your heels keeping spine straight.
Rest hands on thighs.
Relax shoulders and breathe naturally.
Stay steady with an upright posture.
breathing: Soft and steady breaths; maintain long inhalations and exhalations.

name: Vasisthasana
short_description: A strong side-plank posture that enhances arm strength, core stability, and balance.
steps: Begin in a plank position.
Shift weight to one hand and rotate body sideways.
Stack feet on top of each other.
Lift opposite arm toward the ceiling.
Hold with core engaged and hips lifted.
breathing: Inhale to lift hips; exhale to maintain stability.

name: Viparita Virabhadrasana
short_description: Also known as Reverse Warrior, this pose strengthens the legs while stretching the side body and improving spinal mobility.
benefits: Stretches side torso and rib cage
steps: Begin in Warrior II stance.
Slide back hand down the rear leg.
Lift front arm overhead into a side bend.
Keep front knee bent at 90 degrees.
Open chest upward and breathe deeply.
breathing: Inhale to lift the arm; exhale to deepen the side stretch.

name: Virabhadrasana I
short_description: A strong standing posture that builds stamina, opens the chest, and strengthens the legs and core.
steps: Step one foot forward and rotate back foot slightly inward.
Bend front knee to 90 degrees.
Extend arms overhead.
Square hips forward.
Engage core and hold the posture.
breathing: Inhale while lifting arms; exhale while deepening the lunge.

name: Virabhadrasana II
short_description: A grounding warrior pose that strengthens the lower body and enhances stability, focus, and endurance.
steps: Begin standing and step feet wide apart.
Rotate front foot outward and back foot slightly inward.
Bend front knee to 90 degrees.
Extend arms parallel to the floor.
Gaze forward over front hand.
breathing: Smooth and steady breathing while maintaining posture.

name: Virabhadrasana III
short_description: A challenging balancing pose that strengthens the entire posterior chain while improving focus and body control.
benefits: Strengthens hamstrings, glutes, and lower back
steps: Start in a standing position and step one foot back into a high lunge.
Shift weight to the front leg.
Lean torso forward while lifting the back leg up.
Extend arms forward, back, or to the sides.
Form a straight line from head to lifted foot and hold.
breathing: Inhale to lengthen; exhale to stabilize the pose.

name: Vrksasana
short_description: A classic standing balance posture that enhances stability, strengthens legs, and promotes mental focus.
steps: Stand straight with feet together.
Shift weight to one leg.
Place the opposite foot on calf or inner thigh (avoid knee).
Bring hands to chest or raise arms overhead.
Maintain steady gaze and breathe deeply.
common_mistakes: Lack of firm grounding in standing foot
breathing: Calm and steady breaths to maintain balance.

name: Vrischikasana
short_description: A powerful forearm inversion resembling a scorpion that demands strong balance, flexibility, and control.
steps: Start in Dolphin Pose on forearms.
Kick up into a forearm stand.
Engage core and bend knees slowly.
Arch back while lowering feet toward head.
Hold balance with controlled breathing.
breathing: Slow and controlled to maintain stability in inversion.

name: Yogic Sleep Pose
short_description: Also known as Yoga Nidra posture, it is a deep relaxation pose promoting mental clarity and stress relief.
steps: Lie down on your back in Savasana.
Spread legs and arms comfortably.
Close eyes and relax entire body.
Focus awareness on breath and sensations.
Stay still and conscious while relaxing deeply.
breathing: Soft natural breaths promoting relaxation.
